game_description: Experience digital pinball as never before in Pinball FX2 VR, a groundbreaking new pinball game from the digital pinball pioneers at Zen Studios! Pinball FX2 VR features advanced physics, detailed 3D graphics, original table designs, and a robust set of social features and scoreboards making for an engaging VR experience you won‚Äôt find elsewhere. Pinball FX2 VR replicates the atmosphere of real-life pinball machines in a virtual play space, while presenting gameplay features and effects that cannot be physically recreated. Combining the look and feel of digital pinball with the sensation of a real-world experience, Pinball FX2 VR is the premiere place for pinball action on Oculus Quest! ‚ÄúYou'll swear these pinball machines are real.‚Äù‚ÄìCNET.com ‚ÄúPinball FX 2 VR is the way digital pinball is meant to be played.‚Äù-VRFocus ‚Äú‚Ä¶this is one of the best pinball table simulations you will ever play.‚Äù‚ÄìThe VR Shop
review_1: Since a kid I've loved pinball games and couldn't wait to buy this for the quest when I spotted it. Basically it comes with 3 tables for the price,each one very colourful with great sounds and effects. I also purchased 3 more tables afterwards. I know many have said this is a bad way for the devs to do things but I don't object to coughing up an extra bit of cash for the effort they clearly put in. So, I'm enjoying it but what about the issues? Well for me the tables are rather over complicated. There are instructions on the internet for what everything does but even trying to understand them blows my mind! One of my additional tables at one point gave me 6 balls to deal with at the same time. Trouble is all I could really do was watch the balls on the flippers and shoot them into God knows where as if I actually looked where I was trying to aim them they would all end up dropping between the flippers. The main problem for me though is a very annoying sticking of the right flipper in the activated position particularly during multiballs. Had my controller inspected and there's nothing wrong with it that would cause this to happen. So all in all it's a pretty good game with a few flaws that just take the edge off it. A sticky flipper and, (for me at least), over complex tables.
review_2: a "must have" for pinball fans who don't have the means or the space to buy real ones!! I spend hours on it. We still need new tables. Zen Studio: make new tables in 2023 please
review_3: You have a knowledged and forward much of this feedback to the developers. I have seen no true response, action plan or updates. Much of the feedback is on point. The title is not priced correctly as well as dlc. There is one review comparing to Starwars pinball. This title is more in line with correct pricing. I own both titles, however, I agree with many reviewers. Would like to see price adjustments and a more Starwars pinball experience for this vr title. Please pass on this feedback , but also have the principle developers respond to these loyal users. These are good vr titles that can be better and move to the best seller list. Thanks
